title: Citi Launches Prepaid Corporate Card in Brazil
summary: São Paulo - Citibank and Visa, the world's largest payments technology company, announced today the launch of a prepaid card for corporate and public sector clients in Brazil. The product represents a new payment alternative that allows issuers to replace old methods of payment, such as cash, checks or vouchers, with a more secure and efficient electronic payment option.
tag-1: Citi Launches Prepaid Corporate Card in Brazil
tag-3: São Paulo – Citibank and Visa, the world's largest payments technology company, announced today the launch of a prepaid card for corporate and public sector clients in Brazil. The product represents a new payment alternative that allows issuers to replace old methods of payment, such as cash, checks or vouchers, with a more secure and efficient electronic payment option.
tag-4: Visa-branded cards enjoy access to Citi's exclusive global platform, which can be customized according to each client's needs. Designed for large companies and public sector institutions, the card is available in two versions: a rechargeable corporate card that can be used for transactions and withdrawals; and an incentive card, which companies can charge only once and which can be used only for transactions. The corporate card can be charged or recharged for a maximum of R$10,000, up to a maximum monthly balance of R$20,000. The incentive card can be charged only once for up to R$1,500.
tag-5: "Citi prepaid cards make managing payments more efficient, thanks to personalized programs that facilitate payments and offer enhanced security throughout the process," explained Adoniro Cestari, Head of Corporate Products at Citi Brazil. "Offering innovative solutions is one of Citi's global commitments, and to this end we continue to make improved services available for meeting the demands of our clients."
tag-6: "Visa is committed to the prepaid corporate card segment, which enables companies and the public sector to cut costs and increase their operational efficiency by enjoying more secure and convenient access to prepaid products," noted Karen Ferreira, Commercial Products Director at Visa Brazil. "The Citi-Visa platform is one of the most complete platforms available on the market and it serves the full range of corporate clients' needs."
tag-7: Among other benefits, the prepaid cards help corporate clients cut costs and reduce the risk of in-house fraud, as well as the ability to make payments to anyone without going through a bank. Cardholders in turn enjoy improved efficiency, flexibility and the knowledge that their transactions are secure.
tag-8: The prepaid cards can be used for a wide range of purposes, including consumer or distributor payments, referral programs, discounts, disbursements (for employee travel or other work-related expenses) and payments in general.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-10: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-11: Visa Visa is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, banks and governments in more than 200 countries and territories via fast, safe and reliable electronic payments. We operate one of the world's most advanced processing networks – VisaNet – capable of handling more than 30,000 transactions per second, with fraud protection for consumers and guaranteed payment for merchants. Visa is not a bank and does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa's innovations, however, enable its bank customers to offer consumers more choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. For more information, please visit www.moedadoprogresso.com.br and http://brasil.blog.visa.com/.
